overview:
Myriant welcomed Dr. Cenan Ozmeral as a key management team member in November 2008 following his departure from leading chemical manufacturer BASF, where he spent 29 years developing and growing specialty chemicals/polymers businesses.

Most recently, Dr. Ozmeral served as Vice President of the Acrylic Dispersions and XSB Latex Business, NAFTA Region, a unit with annual sales of US$1.8 billion. In this position he was responsible for both manufacturing and R&D operations, had full P&L responsibility, and oversaw the activities of 25 scientists and 75 technicians.

Dr. Ozmeral also ran business units in Petrochemicals, Industrial Organics and Plasticizer Chemicals. During this period, he oversaw the largest capital investment in BASF’s North American history, a $1.3 billion steam cracker in Port Arthur, Texas and the world’s largest butadiene extraction unit. He was responsible for $4 billion in sales including butanol and oversaw a staff of 1,500. He was also responsible for 1,4-Butanediol sales in North America and gained extensive experience in marketing of specialty diols, intermediates, and agrochemicals.
